description: Starts the asynchronous analysis of invoices or receipts for data like contact information, items purchased, and vendor names. StartExpenseAnalysis can analyze text in documents that are in JPEG, PNG, and PDF format. The documents must be stored in an Amazon S3 bucket. Use the  DocumentLocation parameter to specify the name of your S3 bucket and the name of the document in that bucket. StartExpenseAnalysis returns a job identifier ( JobId) that you will provide to GetExpenseAnalysis to retrieve the results of the operation. When the analysis of the input invoices/receipts is finished, Amazon Textract publishes a completion status to the Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS) topic that you provide to the NotificationChannel. To obtain the results of the invoice and receipt analysis operation, ensure that the status value published to the Amazon SNS topic is SUCCEEDED. If so, call  GetExpenseAnalysis, and pass the job identifier ( JobId) that was returned by your call to StartExpenseAnalysis. For more information, see Analyzing Invoices and Receipts.

parameters.name: DocumentLocation
parameters.description: The location of the document to be processed. S3Object (dict) --- The Amazon S3 bucket that contains the input document. Bucket (string) --- The name of the S3 bucket. Note that the # character is not valid in the file name. Name (string) --- The file name of the input document. Image files may be in PDF, TIFF, JPEG, or PNG format. Version (string) --- If the bucket has versioning enabled, you can specify the object version.

nested_params.name: S3Object
nested_params.description: The Amazon S3 bucket that contains the input document.

nested_params.name: Bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the S3 bucket. Note that the # character is not valid in the file name.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The file name of the input document. Image files may be in PDF, TIFF, JPEG, or PNG format.

nested_params.name: Version
nested_params.description: If the bucket has versioning enabled, you can specify the object version.

parameters.name: NotificationChannel
parameters.description: The Amazon SNS topic ARN that you want Amazon Textract to publish the completion status of the operation to. The Amazon SNS topic that Amazon Textract posts the completion status to. The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that gives Amazon Textract publishing permissions to the Amazon SNS topic.

nested_params.name: SNSTopicArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon SNS topic that Amazon Textract posts the completion status to.

nested_params.name: RoleArn
nested_params.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an IAM role that gives Amazon Textract publishing permissions to the Amazon SNS topic.

parameters.name: OutputConfig
parameters.description: Sets if the output will go to a customer defined bucket. By default, Amazon Textract will save the results internally to be accessed by the GetExpenseAnalysis operation. The name of the bucket your output will go to. S3Prefix (string) --- The prefix of the object key that the output will be saved to. When not enabled, the prefix will be 'textract_output'.

nested_params.name: S3Bucket
nested_params.description: The name of the bucket your output will go to.

nested_params.name: S3Prefix
nested_params.description: The prefix of the object key that the output will be saved to. When not enabled, the prefix will be 'textract_output'.

nested_items.name: JobId
nested_items.description: A unique identifier for the text detection job. The JobId is returned from StartExpenseAnalysis. A JobId value is only valid for 7 days.
